RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 1-13, FUNCTION, INTERACTION WITH ZNF148,
RP   SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, AND DNA-BINDING.
RC   TISSUE=Myotube;
RX   PubMed=15190078; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M403160200;
RA   Boopathi E., Lenka N., Prabu S.K., Fang J.-K., Wilkinson F.,
RA   Atchison M., Giallongo A., Avadhani N.G.;
RT   "Regulation of murine cytochrome c oxidase Vb gene expression during
RT   myogenesis: YY-1 and heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein D-like
RT   protein (JKTBP1) reciprocally regulate transcription activity by
RT   physical interaction with the BERF-1/ZBP-89 factor.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 279:35242-35254(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Acts as a transcriptional regulator. Promotes
CC       transcription repression (By similarity). Promotes transcription
CC       activation in differentiated myotubes. Binds to double- and
CC       single-stranded DNA sequences (By similarity). Binds to the
CC       transcription suppressor CATR sequence of the COX5B promoter.
CC       Binds with high affinity to RNA molecules that contain AU-rich
CC       elements (AREs) found within the 3'-UTR of many proto-oncogenes
CC       and cytokine mRNAs (By similarity). Binds both to nuclear and
CC       cytoplasmic poly(A) mRNAs (By similarity). Binds to poly(G) and
CC       poly(A), but not to poly(U) or poly(C) RNA homopolymers (By
CC       similarity). Binds to the 5'-ACUAGC-3' RNA consensus sequence (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with TNPO1 (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       ZNF148. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15190078}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Cytoplasm. Note=Shuttles between
CC       the nucleus and the cytoplasm in a TNPO1-dependent manner.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in skeletal muscle, myoblast,
CC       myotube, heart, brain, liver, kidney, heart, lung, stomach, small
CC       intestine, large intestine, spleen, and testis (at protein level).
CC       Expressed in brain, skeletal muscle, heart, lung, liver, stomach,
CC       small intestine, large intestine, kidney, spleen and testis.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10717477}.
CC   -!- PTM: Dimethylation of Arg-289 is probably of the asymmetric type.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 RRM (RNA recognition motif) domains.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00176}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the core-TFIIH basal transcription factor
CC       involved in nucleotide excision repair (NER) of DNA and, when
CC       complexed to CAK, in RNA transcription by RNA polymerase II.
CC       Anchors XPB (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: One of the 6 subunits forming the core-TFIIH basal
CC       transcription factor which associates with the CAK complex
CC       composed of CDK7, CCNH/cyclin H and MNAT1 to form the TFIIH basal
CC       transcription factor (By similarity). Interacts with RARA; the
CC       interaction requires prior phosphorylation of RARA on 'Ser-369'
CC       which then enhances interaction of RARA with CDK7. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9230306}.

RP   FUNCTION, AND IDENTIFICATION IN THE RAG COMPLEX.

RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: DNA binding proteins that associates with chromatin and
CC       has the ability to bend DNA. Binds preferentially single-stranded
CC       DNA. Involved in V(D)J recombination by acting as a cofactor of
CC       the RAG complex. Acts by stimulating cleavage and RAG protein
CC       binding at the 23 bp spacer of conserved recombination signal
CC       sequences (RSS). Heparin-binding protein that has a role in the
CC       extension of neurite-type cytoplasmic processes in developing
CC       cells. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9184213}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the RAG complex composed of core components
CC       RAG1 and RAG2, and associated component HMGB1 or HMGB2.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9184213}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q8VIM0:Havcr2; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-6665811, EBI-6665112;
CC       Q01860:POU5F1 (xeno); NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-6665811, EBI-475687;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Cytoplasm. Chromosome.
CC       Note=Associated with the plasma membrane of filipodia in process-
CC       growing cells, and also deposited into the substrate-attached
CC       material.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the HMGB family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 HMG box DNA-binding domains.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00267}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Cell surface proteoglycan that bears heparan sulfate.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. Interacts with CDCP1 and SDCBP (By
CC       similarity). Interacts (via its cytoplasmic domain) with GIPC (via
CC       its PDZ domain). Interacts (via its cytoplasmic domain) with
CC       NUDT16L1. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10911369,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11805099}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Single-pass type I membrane
CC       protein. Secreted. Note=Shedding of the ectodomain produces a
CC       soluble form.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Ubiquitous. Highest levels in liver, kidney
CC       and lung.
CC   -!- PTM: Shedding is enhanced by a number of factors such as
CC       heparanase, thrombin or EGF. Also by stress and wound healing.
CC       PMA-mediated shedding is inhibited by TIMP3.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the syndecan proteoglycan family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA].
RC   STRAIN=C57BL/6; TISSUE=Eye;

RG   The MGC Project Team;
RT   "The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA
RT   project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).";
RL   Genome Res. 14:2121-2127(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Promotes intergrin-mediated cell adhesion. May stimulate
CC       host defense against viruses and tumor cells (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimers and homomultimers. The multimers form ring-
CC       like structures with a diameter of 30-40 nm. Binds LGALS1 and
CC       LGALS3. Binds ITGB1, COL4A1, COL5A1, COL6A1, FN1 and NID (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with PPIC (in vitro). {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8341703}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000250}. Secreted,
CC       extracellular space, extracellular matrix
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8119883}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in embryo, liver, spleen, kidney,
CC       lung, heart, intestine, thymus and lymph node.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8119883, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8341703}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Up-regulated by TNF and IFNG.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8119883}.
CC   -!- PTM: N-glycosylated. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8341703}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 BACK (BTB/Kelch associated) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC       ProRule:PRU00037}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in peroxisome biosynthesis and integrity.
CC       Assembles membrane vesicles before the matrix proteins are
CC       translocated. As a docking factor for PEX19, is necessary for the
CC       import of peroxisomal membrane proteins in the peroxisomes.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with PEX19. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Peroxisome membrane; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Identified in all tissues analyzed, with the
CC       strongest expression in liver and in testis.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the peroxin-3 family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for checkpoint mediated arrest of cell cycle
CC       progression in response to DNA damage during S-phase (the intra-S-
CC       phase checkpoint). This checkpoint requires activation of at least
CC       2 parallel pathways by the ATM kinase: one involves the MRN
CC       (MRE11A-RAD50-NBS1) complex, while the second requires CHEK2. RIF1
CC       seems to act independently of both these pathways. Seems to play
CC       no role in either the G1/S or G2/M DNA damage checkpoints (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: A fraction of the protein may interact with TRF2.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q80Z64:Nanog; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-2312621, EBI-2312517;
CC       Q61066:Nr0b1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-2312621, EBI-2312665;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15042697}.
CC       Chromosome, telomere {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15042697}. Cytoplasm,
CC       cytoskeleton, spindle {ECO:0000250}. Note=Exhibits ATM- and
CC       TP53BP1-dependent localization to uncapped or aberrant telomeres
CC       and to DNA double strand breaks (DSBs). Localizes to microtubules
CC       of the midzone of the mitotic spindle during anaphase, and to
CC       condensed chromosomes in telophase (By similarity). While the
CC       majority of the protein appears nuclear and distinct from normal
CC       telomere structures, a small fraction may bind to telomeres in
CC       embryonic stem cells. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q6PR54-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q6PR54-2; Sequence=VSP_014433;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q6PR54-3; Sequence=VSP_014432;
CC         Note=May be due to a competing acceptor splice site. No
CC         experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in Sertoli cells, prospermatagonia,
CC       early primary spermatocytes, and in oocytes at all stages of their
CC       growth. Expressed in embryonic stem (ES) and embryonic germ (EG)
CC       cells: expression is lost upon differentiation.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15042697}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Found in the nucleus of germinal-vesicle (GV)
CC       stage oocytes prior to fertilization. Accumulates in the male and
CC       female pronucleus after fertilization. Expressed in the nuclei of
CC       all blastomeres from the two cell stage to the compacted morula
CC       stage, although absent from the polar body and inner cell mass
CC       (ICM). Found in the nuclei of polar and mural trophectoderm cells
CC       from E3.5, and at high levels in the epiblast from E5.5 to E7.5.
CC       Expressed by primitive germ cells (PGCs) in both male and female
CC       from E9.5 to E13.5, at which point expression declines. A low
CC       level is observed in Sertoli cells of the testis at E17.5.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15042697}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Membrane-cytoskeleton-associated protein that promotes
CC       the assembly of the spectrin-actin network. Binds to calmodulin.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of an alpha and a beta subunit or an alpha
CC       and a gamma subunit.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton. Cell membrane;
CC       Peripheral membrane protein; Cytoplasmic side.

CC   -!- DOMAIN: Each subunit is comprised of three regions: a NH2-terminal
CC       protease-resistant globular head region, a short connecting
CC       subdomain, and a protease-sensitive tail region.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Acyl-CoA thioesterase that catalyzes the hydrolysis of
CC       phytanoyl-CoA and pristanoyl-CoA to free fatty acids and coenzyme
CC       A (CoASH). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17613526}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=24 uM for pristanoyl-CoA {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17613526};
CC         Vmax=3.2 umol/min/mg enzyme {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17613526};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Peroxisome {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17613526}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q32Q92-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q32Q92-2; Sequence=VSP_028234, VSP_028235;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in white adipose tissue.
CC       Detected at lower levels in kidney, liver, brown adipose tissue
CC       and brain. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17613526}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Up-regulated in liver upon treatment with peroxisome
CC       proliferator. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17613526}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the C/M/P thioester hydrolase family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [9]
RP   DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE, FUNCTION, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, INTERACTION WITH
RP   CCNY, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=22184064; DOI=10.1128/MCB.06261-11;
RA   Mikolcevic P., Sigl R., Rauch V., Hess M.W., Pfaller K., Barisic M.,
RA   Pelliniemi L.J., Boesl M., Geley S.;
RT   "Cyclin-dependent kinase 16/PCTAIRE kinase 1 is activated by cyclin Y
RT   and is essential for spermatogenesis.";
RL   Mol. Cell. Biol. 32:868-879(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Protein kinase that plays a role in vesicle-mediated
CC       transport processes and exocytosis. Can phosphorylate CCNY at
CC       'Ser-336' (in vitro) (By similarity). Plays a role in the
CC       regulation of insulin secretion in response to changes in blood
CC       glucose levels. Regulates GH1 release by brain neurons.
CC       Phosphorylates NSF, and thereby regulates NSF oligomerization.
CC       Required for normal spermatogenesis. Regulates neuron
CC       differentiation and dendrite development. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16461345, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21335063,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22184064, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22798068}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16461345, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22184064,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22796189}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Found in a complex containing CABLES1, CDK17 and TDRD7.
CC       Interacts with BRSK2. Identified in a complex with NSF, syntaxin-
CC       1, synaptotagmin, SYN1, SYP and CDK5R1 (By similarity). Interacts
CC       with YWHAH, YWHAQ and YWHAZ. Interacts with CCNY; this increases
CC       the CDK16 kinase activity. Interacts with NSF. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16461345, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22184064,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22796189, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9197417}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasmic
CC       vesicle, secretory vesicle. Cell junction, synapse, synaptosome.
CC       Note=Colocalizes with insulin in pancreas islets. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=Long;
CC         IsoId=Q04735-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=Short;
CC         IsoId=Q04735-2; Sequence=VSP_004801, VSP_004802;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in testis and brain, and
CC       detected at lower levels in heart, skeletal muscle, adipose
CC       tissue, lung, spleen and pancreas (at protein level). Ubiquitous
CC       with highest levels in testis and brain, with longer form
CC       predominant in all tissues except the testis.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22184064, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22796189,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22798068}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylation at Ser-153 inhibits kinase activity.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No visible phenotype in females; they are
CC       viable and fertile. Male mice are infertile, due to a defect in
CC       late stages of spermatogenesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22184064}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. CMGC
CC       Ser/Thr protein kinase family. CDC2/CDKX subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 protein kinase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00159}.

RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT SER-183 AND TYR-213, AND
RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=19131326; DOI=10.1074/mcp.M800451-MCP200;
RA   Sweet S.M., Bailey C.M., Cunningham D.L., Heath J.K., Cooper H.J.;
RT   "Large scale localization of protein phosphorylation by use of
RT   electron capture dissociation mass spectrometry.";
RL   Mol. Cell. Proteomics 8:904-912(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: May act in negative regulation of cell growth and
CC       transformation by interacting with nonreceptor tyrosine kinases
CC       ABL1 and/or ABL2. In vitro, at least isoform 2 and isoform 4
CC       suppress the transforming activity of Abelson murine leukemia
CC       virus (v-Abl) after overexpression in fibroblasts. May play a role
CC       in regulation EGF-induced Erk pathway activation. Involved in
CC       cytoskeletal reorganization and EGFR signaling. Together with EPS8
CC       participates in transduction of signals from Ras to Rac. In vitro,
CC       a trimeric complex of ABI1, EPS8 and SOS1 exhibits Rac specific
CC       guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) activity and ABI1 seems
CC       to act as an adapter in the complex. Regulates ABL1/c-Abl-mediated
CC       phosphorylation of ENAH. Recruits WASF1 to lamellipodia and there
CC       seems to regulate WASF1 protein level. In brain, seems to regulate
CC       the dendritic outgrowth and branching as well as to determine the
CC       shape and number of synaptic contacts of developing neurons.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10499589, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11526477,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12672821, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15143189,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15558031, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7590237}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with ENAH, Abelson murine leukemia virus V-ABL,
CC       ABL1, STX1A, SNAP25, VAMP2, and through its N-terminus with WASF1.
CC       Part of a complex consisting of ABI1, STX1A and SNAP25. Part of a
CC       complex consisting of ABI1, EPS8 and SOS1. Interacts with EPS8,
CC       SOS1, SOS2, GRB2, SPTA1, and the first SH3 domain of NCK1 (By
CC       similarity). Component of the WAVE2 complex composed of ABI1,
CC       CYFIP1/SRA1, NCKAP1/NAP1 and WASF2/WAVE2. Interacts (via SH3
CC       domain) with SHANK2 and SHANK3, but not SHANK1; the interaction is
CC       direct. Interacts with the heterodimer MYC:MAX; the interaction
CC       may enhance MYC:MAX transcriptional activity. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10499589, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12672821,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15143189, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15558031,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:7590237}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q08509:Eps8; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-375511, EBI-375596;
CC       Q02384:Sos2; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-375511, EBI-395573;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Cell projection, lamellipodium {ECO:0000250}. Cell
CC       projection, filopodium {ECO:0000250}. Cell projection, growth cone
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Cell junction, synapse, postsynaptic cell membrane,
CC       postsynaptic density {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Localized to protruding lamellipodia and
CC       filopodia tips. Also localized to neuronal growth cones and
CC       synaptosomes. May shuttle from the postsynaptic densities to the
CC       nucleus (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=5;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q8CBW3-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=short;
CC         IsoId=Q8CBW3-2; Sequence=VSP_010756, VSP_010757, VSP_010758;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q8CBW3-3; Sequence=VSP_010756;
CC       Name=4; Synonyms=long;
CC         IsoId=Q8CBW3-4; Sequence=VSP_010756, VSP_010757;
CC       Name=5;
CC         IsoId=Q8CBW3-5; Sequence=VSP_010756, VSP_022636;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed with highest levels in bone
CC       marrow, spleen, brain, testes, and embryonic brain. In adult brain
CC       prominently expressed in the neocortex, hippocampus and dentate
CC       gyrus. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10995551, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7590237}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Detected at E10 and E12 in developing brain,
CC       but does not appear more prominent in the neuroepithelium compared
CC       to the surrounding tissue. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10995551}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The t-SNARE coiled-coil homology domain is necessary and
CC       sufficient for interaction with STX1A.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on tyrosine residues after serum stimulation
CC       or induction by v-Abl. Seems to be phosphorylated at Tyr-53 by
CC       ABL1, required for nuclear but not for synaptic localization (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the ABI family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 SH3 domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00192}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 t-SNARE coiled-coil homology domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00202}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Hydrolyzes NAD(P)H to NMNH and AMP (2',5'-ADP), and
CC       diadenosine diphosphate to AMP. Has also activity towards
CC       NAD(P)(+), ADP-ribose and diadenosine triphosphate. May act to
CC       regulate the concentration of peroxisomal nicotinamide nucleotide
CC       cofactors required for oxidative metabolism in this organelle (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

RA   Gosens I., Sessa A., den Hollander A.I., Letteboer S.J.F., Belloni V.,

RT   "FERM protein EPB41L5 is a novel member of the mammalian CRB-MPP5

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May contribute to the correct positioning of tight
CC       junctions during the establishment of polarity in epithelial
CC       cells. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with MPP5, CRB2 and CRB3. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17920587}.
CC       Cell junction, adherens junction {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17920587}.
CC       Note=Associated with the plasma membrane. During embryonic
CC       development, tends to be associated with the basolateral side of
CC       the plasma membrane in various tissues. In the adult kidney, found
CC       at the basolateral and apical sides of the tubules. In the adult
CC       retina, colocalizes with CTNNB1, an adherens junction marker.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q8BGS1-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q8BGS1-2; Sequence=VSP_033040, VSP_033041;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q8BGS1-3; Sequence=VSP_033039;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: In the retina, expressed at the region of the
CC       outer limiting membrane, as well as in the retinal pigment
CC       epithelium, outer nuclear and outer plexiform layers. Also
CC       detected in the inner segments (at protein level). Expressed in
CC       the kidney (at protein level). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17920587}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: At 10.5 dpc, strongly expressed in the
CC       developing neural tube and optic vesicle, as well as in the
CC       branchial arches and kidney. In the developing kidney, detected in
CC       the mesonephrotic tubules. At 11.5 dpc, expressed along the entire
CC       cranial-caudal length of the developing neural tube, including the
CC       anterior forebrain and the posterior spinal cord. Always
CC       restricted to the ventricular layer, where proliferative cells are
CC       located. Conversely, not detected in postmitotic neural
CC       compartments. In the developing lung, at 11.5 dpc, expressed in
CC       the internal endodermal layer and in particular in the nascent
CC       bronchial tips. At 12.5 dpc, in the optic vesicle, detected mainly
CC       in the retinal layer. The retinal pigment epithelium shows only
CC       background levels. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17920587}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The FERM domain binds to CRB1. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 FERM domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00084}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA] (ISOFORM LONG), AND ALTERNATIVE SPLICING.
RC   TISSUE=Embryo;
RX   PubMed=8530046; DOI=10.1006/geno.1995.1151;
RA   Yoshioka H., Inoguchi K., Khaleduzzaman M., Ninomiya Y.,
RA   Andrikopoulos K., Ramirez F.;

RN   [3]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA] OF 181-198, AND DISEASE.
RC   STRAIN=C57BL/6;
RX   PubMed=7859283; DOI=10.1016/0092-8674(95)90492-1;
RA   Li Y., Lacerda D.A., Warman M.L., Beier D.R., Yoshioka H.,
RA   Ninomiya Y., Oxford J.T., Morris N.P., Andrikopoulos K., Ramirez F.,
RA   Wardell B.B., Lifferth G.D., Teuscher C., Woodward S.R., Taylor B.A.,
RA   Seegmiller R.E., Olsen B.R.;
RT   "A fibrillar collagen gene, Col11a1, is essential for skeletal
RT   morphogenesis.";
RL   Cell 80:423-430(1995).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: May play an important role in fibrillogenesis by
CC       controlling lateral growth of collagen II fibrils.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Trimers composed of three different chains: alpha 1(XI),
CC       alpha 2(XI), and alpha 3(XI). Alpha 3(XI) is a post-translational
CC       modification of alpha 1(II). Alpha 1(V) can also be found instead
CC       of alpha 3(XI)=1(II) (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted, extracellular space, extracellular
CC       matrix {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00793}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=Long;
CC         IsoId=Q61245-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=Short;
CC         IsoId=Q61245-2; Sequence=VSP_001147;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The C-terminal propeptide, also known as COLFI domain,
CC       have crucial roles in tissue growth and repair by controlling both
CC       the intracellular assembly of procollagen molecules and the
CC       extracellular assembly of collagen fibrils. It binds a calcium ion
CC       which is essential for its function (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Prolines at the third position of the tripeptide repeating
CC       unit (G-X-Y) are hydroxylated in some or all of the chains.
CC   -!- PTM: N-glycosylated. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=Defects in Col11a1 are associated with
CC       chondrodysplasia, an autosomal recessive disease characterized by
CC       skeletal defects caused by abnormalities in the cartilage of
CC       limbs, ribs, mandibles and trachea. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7859283}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the fibrillar collagen family.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00793}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 6 collagen-like domains. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 fibrillar collagen NC1 domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00793}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 laminin G-like domain. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in maintaining the homeostasis of cellular
CC       nucleotides by catalyzing the interconversion of nucleoside
CC       phosphates. Has GTP:AMP phosphotransferase and ITP:AMP
CC       phosphotransferase activities. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03169}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: NTP + AMP = NDP + ADP. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03169}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03169}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Mitochondrion matrix {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03169}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Consists of three domains, a large central CORE domain and
CC       two small peripheral domains, NMPbind and LID, which undergo
CC       movements during catalysis. The LID domain closes over the site of
CC       phosphoryl transfer upon GTP binding. Assembling and dissambling
CC       the active center during each catalytic cycle provides an
CC       effective means to prevent GTP hydrolysis. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03169}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the adenylate kinase family. AK3 subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03169}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the reversible transfer of the terminal
CC       phosphate group between ATP and AMP. Plays an important role in
CC       cellular energy homeostasis and in adenine nucleotide metabolism.
CC       Adenylate kinase activity is critical for regulation of the
CC       phosphate utilization and the AMP de novo biosynthesis pathways.
CC       Plays a key role in hematopoiesis. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03168}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + AMP = 2 ADP. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03168}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03168}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Mitochondrion intermembrane space
CC       {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03168}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9WTP6-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9WTP6-2; Sequence=VSP_036504;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Present in the inner ear. Not detected in the
CC       vestibule at any developmental stage. Present at high level in the
CC       cochlea uniquely in the stria vascularis at postnatal day 7 but
CC       not at birth. Present within the lumen of the stria vascularis
CC       capillaries. Not detected in the capillaries or vessels of the
CC       adjacent connective tissue (at protein level).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19043416}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Consists of three domains, a large central CORE domain and
CC       two small peripheral domains, NMPbind and LID, which undergo
CC       movements during catalysis. The LID domain closes over the site of
CC       phosphoryl transfer upon ATP binding. Assembling and dissambling
CC       the active center during each catalytic cycle provides an
CC       effective means to prevent ATP hydrolysis. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03168}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the adenylate kinase family. AK2 subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03168}.

RP   STRUCTURE BY NMR OF 273-363.
RG   RIKEN structural genomics initiative (RSGI);
RT   "Solution structure of the alpha-helical domain from mouse
RT   hypothetical PNPase.";
RL   Submitted (NOV-2004) to the PDB data bank.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: RNA-binding protein implicated in numerous RNA metabolic
CC       processes. Catalyzes the phosphorolysis of single-stranded
CC       polyribonucleotides processively in the 3'-to-5' direction.
CC       Mitochondrial intermembrane factor with RNA-processing
CC       exoribonulease activity. Component of the mitochondrial
CC       degradosome (mtEXO) complex, that degrades 3' overhang double-
CC       stranded RNA with a 3'-to-5' directionality in an ATP-dependent
CC       manner. Required for correct processing and polyadenylation of
CC       mitochondrial mRNAs. Plays a role as a cytoplasmic RNA import
CC       factor that mediates the translocation of small RNA components,
CC       like the 5S RNA, the RNA subunit of ribonuclease P and the
CC       mitochondrial RNA-processing (MRP) RNA, into the mitochondrial
CC       matrix. Plays a role in mitochondrial morphogenesis and
CC       respiration; regulates the expression of the electron transport
CC       chain (ETC) components at the mRNA and protein levels. In the
CC       cytoplasm, shows a 3'-to-5' exoribonuclease mediating mRNA
CC       degradation activity; degrades c-myc mRNA upon treatment with
CC       IFNB1/IFN-beta, resulting in a growth arrest in melanoma cells.
CC       Regulates the stability of specific mature miRNAs in melanoma
CC       cells; specifically and selectively degrades miR-221,
CC       preferentially. Plays also a role in RNA cell surveillance by
CC       cleaning up oxidized RNAs. Binds to the RNA subunit of
CC       ribonuclease P, MRP RNA and miR-221 microRNA.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20691904}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: RNA(n+1) + phosphate = RNA(n) + a nucleoside
CC       diphosphate.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotrimer; in free form. Homooligomer. Component of the
CC       mitochondrial degradosome (mtEXO) complex which is a
CC       heteropentamer containing 2 copies of SUPV3L1 and 3 copies of
CC       PNPT1. Interacts with TCL1A; the interaction has no effect on
CC       PNPT1 exonuclease activity (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Mitochondrion
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Mitochondrion intermembrane space
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16966381}; Peripheral membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16966381}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q8K1R3-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q8K1R3-2; Sequence=VSP_013639, VSP_013640;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Mice show alteration in the mechanisms of
CC       polycistronic mtRNAs processing in mitochondria, resulting in
CC       fewer mature mtRNAs and a reduction in electron transport chain
CC       (ETC) components formation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20691904}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the polyribonucleotide
CC       nucleotidyltransferase family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 KH domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00117}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 S1 motif domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00180}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAO33354.1; Type=Frameshift; Positions=3, 6, 20, 23, 273, 286, 300, 312, 314, 320, 325; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), which plays
CC       a key role in de novo assembly and insertion of NPC in the nuclear
CC       envelope. Required for NPC and nuclear envelope assembly, possibly
CC       by forming a link between the nuclear envelope membrane and
CC       soluble nucleoporins, thereby anchoring the NPC in the membrane
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with the NUP35/NUP53. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nuclear pore complex {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Nucleus membrane {ECO:0000250}; Multi-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Central core structure of the nuclear pore
CC       complex. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the NDC1 family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA].
RC   STRAIN=FVB/N; TISSUE=Mammary tumor;
RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;

RN   [3]
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 76-86; 108-116; 263-278; 284-290; 342-360; 397-419
RP   AND 450-458, AND IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=C57BL/6; TISSUE=Brain;
RA   Lubec G., Kang S.U.;
RL   Submitted (APR-2007) to UniProtKB.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Subunit of the peripheral V1 complex of vacuolar ATPase.
CC       Subunit H activates the ATPase activity of the enzyme and couples
CC       ATPase activity to proton flow. Vacuolar ATPase is responsible for
CC       acidifying a variety of intracellular compartments in eukaryotic
CC       cells, thus providing most of the energy required for transport
CC       processes in the vacuolar system. Involved in the endocytosis
CC       mediated by clathrin-coated pits, required for the formation of
CC       endosomes (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: V-ATPase is a heteromultimeric enzyme composed of a
CC       peripheral catalytic V1 complex (components A to H) attached to an
CC       integral membrane V0 proton pore complex (components: a, c, c',
CC       c'' and d). Interacts with AP2M1 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the V-ATPase H subunit family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RP   GLYCOSYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT ASN-74; ASN-615 AND ASN-869.
RX   PubMed=19349973; DOI=10.1038/nbt.1532;
RA   Wollscheid B., Bausch-Fluck D., Henderson C., O'Brien R., Bibel M.,
RA   Schiess R., Aebersold R., Watts J.D.;
RT   "Mass-spectrometric identification and relative quantification of N-
RT   linked cell surface glycoproteins.";
RL   Nat. Biotechnol. 27:378-386(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The alpha-V (ITGAV) integrins are receptors for
CC       vitronectin, cytotactin, fibronectin, fibrinogen, laminin, matrix
CC       metalloproteinase-2, osteopontin, osteomodulin, prothrombin,
CC       thrombospondin and vWF. They recognize the sequence R-G-D in a
CC       wide array of ligands. Alpha-V integrins may play a role in embryo
CC       implantation, angiogenesis and wound healing. Mice expressing a
CC       null mutation of the alpha-V subunit gene survive until late in
CC       embryonic development and occasionally even to birth. They
CC       demonstrate cleft palate, and defective development of CNS and
CC       gastrointestinal blood vessels.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of an alpha and a beta subunit. The alpha
CC       subunit is composed of a heavy and a light chain linked by a
CC       disulfide bond. Alpha-V (ITGAV) associates with either beta-1
CC       (ITGB1), beta-3 (ITGB3), beta-5 (ITGB5), beta-6 (ITGB6) or beta-8
CC       (ITGB8) (Probable). Interacts with RAB25. Interacts with CIB1 (By
CC       similarity). Integrins ITGAV:ITGB3 and ITGAV:ITGB5 interact with
CC       FBLN5 (via N-terminus)(PubMed:11805835).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P06756, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11805835,
CC       ECO:0000305|PubMed:11805835}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane; Single-pass type I membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the integrin alpha chain family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 7 FG-GAP repeats. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC       hydroxyproline in -Xaa-Pro-Gly- sequences in collagens and other
CC       proteins.

CC       O(2) = trans-4-hydroxy-L-proline-[procollagen] + succinate +
CC       CO(2).

RX   PubMed=14988405; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M312106200;
RA   Becamel C., Gavarini S., Chanrion B., Alonso G., Galeotti N.,

RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT SER-676 (ISOFORM 2),
RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT SER-710 (ISOFORM 3), AND
RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=17242355; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0609836104;
RA   Villen J., Beausoleil S.A., Gerber S.A., Gygi S.P.;
RT   "Large-scale phosphorylation analysis of mouse liver.";

RN   [10]
RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT TYR-399, AND IDENTIFICATION
RP   BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Brain;
RX   PubMed=18034455; DOI=10.1021/pr0701254;
RA   Ballif B.A., Carey G.R., Sunyaev S.R., Gygi S.P.;
RT   "Large-scale identification and evolution indexing of tyrosine
RT   phosphorylation sites from murine brain.";
RL   J. Proteome Res. 7:311-318(2008).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Essential multidomain scaffolding protein required for
CC       normal development. Recruits channels, receptors and signaling
CC       molecules to discrete plasma membrane domains in polarized cells.
CC       Regulates the excitability of cardiac myocytes by modulating the
CC       functional expression of Kv4 channels (By similarity). Functional
CC       regulator of Kv1.5 channel (By similarity). May play a role in
CC       adherens junction assembly, signal transduction, cell
CC       proliferation, synaptogenesis and lymphocyte activation.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11238884}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer (Probable). Interacts with KCNF1 and CAMK2
CC       (By similarity). Interacts through its PDZ domains with KCND2 and
CC       KCND3 (By similarity). Interacts with CAMK2 (By similarity).
CC       Interacts through its PDZ domains with GRIN2A, KCNA1, KCNA2,
CC       KCNA3, KCNA4, KCNA5, GRIA1, GPR124 and GPR125. Interacts with
CC       cytoskeleton-associated proteins EPB41 and EZR. Found in a complex
CC       with KCNA5 and CAV3. Found in a complex with APC and CTNNB1.
CC       Interacts with CDH1 through binding to PIK3R1. Forms multiprotein
CC       complexes with CASK, LIN7A, LIN7B, LIN7C, APBA1, and KCNJ12.
CC       Interacts through its guanylate kinase-like domain with DLGAP1,
CC       DLGAP2, DLGAP3, DLGAP4, MAP1A and KIF13B. Interacts with TOPK.
CC       Forms a tripartite complex composed of DLG1, MPP7 and LIN7 (LIN7A
CC       or LIN7C). May interact with TJAP1 (By similarity). May interact
CC       with HTR2A. Interacts with LRFN1, LRFN2, LRFN4 and SFPQ (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with PTEN (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       FRMPD4 (via C-terminus) (By similarity). {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q62108:Dlg4; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-514290, EBI-300895;
CC       P06463:E6 (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-514290, EBI-1186926;
CC       Q80TG9:Lrfn2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-514290, EBI-877092;
CC       Q810U4:Nrcam; NbExp=6; IntAct=EBI-514290, EBI-8321816;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane {ECO:0000250}; Peripheral membrane
CC       protein {ECO:0000250}. Basolateral cell membrane {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Endoplasmic reticulum membrane {ECO:0000250}. Cell junction,
CC       synapse, postsynaptic cell membrane, postsynaptic density
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Cell junction, synapse. Note=Colocalizes with EPB41
CC       at regions of intercellular contacts. Basolateral in epithelial
CC       cells. May also associate with endoplasmic reticulum membranes.
CC       Mainly found in neurons soma, moderately found at postsynaptic
CC       densities (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q811D0-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q811D0-2; Sequence=VSP_012866, VSP_012867;
CC         Note=Contains a phosphoserine at position 676.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17242355};
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q811D0-3; Sequence=VSP_012868;
CC         Note=Contains a phosphoserine at position 710.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17242355};
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in epithelial, mesenchymal,
CC       neuronal, endothelial and hematopoietic cells during
CC       embryogenesis. Expressed in fibroblasts and T-cells. Widely
CC       expressed in adult mice. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11238884}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The PDZ domains may also mediate association to membranes
CC       by binding to EPB41 and GPR124 together with the L27 domain that
CC       binds CASK and DLG2. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The L27 domain may regulate DLG1 self-association. The N-
CC       terminal alternatively spliced region is capable of binding
CC       several SH3 domains and also moderates the level of protein
CC       oligomerization (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated by MAPK12. Phosphorylation of Ser-232
CC       regulates association with GRIN2A (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Mice have craniofacial abnormalities as well
CC       as a cleft palate. They are smaller than heterozygous littermates,
CC       unable to feed and die within 24 hours of birth.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11238884}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the MAGUK family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 guanylate kinase-like domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00100}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 L27 domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00365}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 3 PDZ (DHR) domains. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00143}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 SH3 domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00192}.

RN   [3]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA].
RC   STRAIN=FVB/N-3; TISSUE=Mammary tumor;
RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;
RG   The MGC Project Team;
RT   "The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA
RT   project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).";
RL   Genome Res. 14:2121-2127(2004).
RN   [4]
RP   FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, INDUCTION, AND DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RX   PubMed=19451219; DOI=10.1101/gad.1779509;
RA   Chen Y.F., Kao C.H., Chen Y.T., Wang C.H., Wu C.Y., Tsai C.Y.,
RA   Liu F.C., Yang C.W., Wei Y.H., Hsu M.T., Tsai S.F., Tsai T.F.;
RT   "Cisd2 deficiency drives premature aging and causes mitochondria-
RT   mediated defects in mice.";
RL   Genes Dev. 23:1183-1194(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Regulator of autophagy that contributes to antagonize
CC       BECN1-mediated cellular autophagy at the endoplasmic reticulum.
CC       Participates in the interaction of BCL2 with BECN1 and is required
CC       for BCL2-mediated depression of endoplasmic reticulum Ca(2+)
CC       stores during autophagy. Contributes to BIK-initiated autophagy,
CC       while it is not involved in BIK-dependent activation of caspases.
CC       Involved in life span control, probably via its function as
CC       regulator of autophagy (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=[2Fe-2S] cluster; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:49601;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 [2Fe-2S] cluster. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Redox potential:
CC         E is 0 +/- 10 mV for 2Fe-2S at pH 7.5.;
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. Interacts with BCL2; the interaction is direct
CC       and disrupted by BIK interaction with BCL2. Interacts with BCL2L1.
CC       Interacts with ITPR1 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19451219}; Single-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19451219}. Mitochondrion outer membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19451219}; Single-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19451219}. Note=According to PubMed:19451219,
CC       it mainly localizes to the mitochondrion outer membrane and
CC       localizes only at low level to the endoplasmic reticulum. However,
CC       inverse results are observed in human cells.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Brain. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17029606}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Expression decreases in an age-dependent manner.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19451219}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Premature aging associated with a shortened
CC       life span, probably caused by mitochondrial degeneration and
CC       autophagy. 8 week old mice begin to acquire a set of aged
CC       appearance phenomena remarkably similar to those of premature
CC       aging syndrome, including prominent eyes and protruding ears.
CC       Ocular abnormalities are observed: mice develop opaque eyes and
CC       blindness, which is accompanied by cornea damage at 20 week old.
CC       The opacity of the cornea is due to debris deposition in the scar
CC       tissue outside the cornea. In addition, corneal neovascularization
CC       is observed, possibly impairing vision. An early depigmentation in
CC       the fur at around 48 week old is also observed; furthermore, hair
CC       follicle atrophy and a decreased hair density is detected. A
CC       decrease in the hair regrowth rate is also observed. Additionally,
CC       the skin of 48-week-old mice exhibits a phenotype with a
CC       noticeably thickened dermis, an expanded surface, and a
CC       significant decrease in subcutaneous adipose tissue and muscle.
CC       The trabeculae of the femur are noticeably thinner and dual energy
CC       X-ray absorptiometer (DEXA) detects a decrease in femur density
CC       after 8 week old. Mice also display a significant lordokyphosis
CC       phenotype after 12 week old; leading to a decrease in mean
CC       thoracic volume and thence pulmonary function abnormalities.
CC       Muscle degeneration is detectable at 3 week old with a progressive
CC       degeneration of muscle fibers and the magnitude of the
CC       degeneration exacerbated with age. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19451219}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the CISD protein family. CISD2 subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.3 ANGSTROMS) OF 246-253 IN COMPLEX WITH MHC.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Promotes degradation of target mRNA species. Plays a
CC       role in the regulation of circadian mRNA stability. Binds GTP and
CC       has GTPase activity (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with EXOSC2/RRP4, EXOSC3/RRP40, EXOSC5/RRP46,
CC       HNRNPD, HNRNPR and SYNCRIP. Identified in a complex with AANAT
CC       mRNA, but does not bind mRNA by itself (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10938096}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in some neurons in the brain cortex.
CC       Detected in small arteries, dendritic cells and macrophages in the
CC       thymus. Detected in lung bronchi, in bronchial epithelial cells
CC       and in bronchial smooth muscle cells. Detected in smooth muscle
CC       cells in a broad range of organs (at protein level). Expressed in
CC       brain, thymus, lung, and kidney. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10938096,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9070279}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No visible phenotype. Mice are born at the
CC       expected Mendelian ratio, develop normally and are fertile. They
CC       exhibit increased stability of some mRNA species.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10938096, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21515746}.

RP   CITRULLINATION AT ARG-140.
RX   PubMed=24463520; DOI=10.1038/nature12942;
RA   Christophorou M.A., Castelo-Branco G., Halley-Stott R.P.,
RA   Oliveira C.S., Loos R., Radzisheuskaya A., Mowen K.A., Bertone P.,

RN   [10]
RP   STRUCTURE BY NMR OF 105-182.
RX   PubMed=12809490; DOI=10.1021/bi034062o;
RA   Perez-Alvarado G.C., Martinez-Yamout M., Allen M.M., Grosschedl R.,
RA   Dyson H.J., Wright P.E.;
RT   "Structure of the nuclear factor ALY: insights into post-
RT   transcriptional regulatory and mRNA nuclear export processes.";
RL   Biochemistry 42:7348-7357(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Export adapter involved in nuclear export of spliced and
CC       unspliced mRNA. Binds mRNA which is thought to be transferred to
CC       the NXF1-NXT1 heterodimer for export (TAP/NFX1 pathway). Component
CC       of the TREX complex which is thought to couple mRNA transcription,
CC       processing and nuclear export, and specifically associates with
CC       spliced mRNA and not with unspliced pre-mRNA. TREX is recruited to
CC       spliced mRNAs by a transcription-independent mechanism, binds to
CC       mRNA upstream of the exon-junction complex (EJC) and is recruited
CC       in a splicing- and cap-dependent manner to a region near the 5'
CC       end of the mRNA where it functions in mRNA export to the
CC       cytoplasm. TREX recruitment occurs via an interaction between
CC       ALYREF/THOC4 and the cap-binding protein NCBP1. Required for TREX
CC       complex assembly and for linking DDX39B to the cap-binding complex
CC       (CBC). In conjunction with THOC5 functions in NXF1-NXT1 mediated
CC       nuclear export of HSP70 mRNA; both proteins enhance the RNA
CC       binding activity of NXF1 and are required for NXF1 localization to
CC       the nuclear rim. Involved in the nuclear export of intronless
CC       mRNA; proposed to be recruited to intronless mRNA by ATP-bound
CC       DDX39B. Involved in transcription elongation and genome stability.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Acts as chaperone and promotes the dimerization of
CC       transcription factors containing basic leucine zipper (bZIP)
CC       domains and thereby promotes transcriptional activation.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homomultimer. Is part of several complexes involved in
CC       mRNA processing and export. Component of the transcription/export
CC       (TREX) complex at least composed of ALYREF/THOC4, DDX39B,
CC       SARNP/CIP29, CHTOP and the THO subcomplex; TREX seems to have a
CC       dynamic structure involving ATP-dependent remodeling; in the
CC       complex interacts (via C-terminus) directly with DDX39B and
CC       interacts directly with THOC1 and THOC2. Found in mRNA splicing-
CC       dependent exon junction complexes (EJC). Identified in the
CC       spliceosome C complex. Found in a mRNP complex with UPF3A and
CC       UPF3B. Interacts with RBM8A, NCBP1, THOC5, LEF1, RUNX1, EIF4A3,
CC       RNPS1, SRRM1, IWS1 and EXOSC1. Interacts with NXF1; the
CC       interaction is direct. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10786854}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9119228}.
CC       Nucleus speckle {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9119228}. Note=Colocalizes with the core EJC,
CC       ALYREF/THOC4, NXF1 and DDX39B in the nucleus and nuclear speckles.
CC       Localizes to regions surrounding nuclear speckles known as
CC       perispeckles in which TREX complex assembly seems to occur (By
CC       similarity). Travels to the cytoplasm as part of the exon junction
CC       complex (EJC) bound to mRNA. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Refbp1-I;
CC         IsoId=O08583-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Refbp1-II;
CC         IsoId=O08583-2; Sequence=VSP_008597;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in heart, brain, spleen,
CC       lung, liver, skeletal muscle, kidney and testis.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9119228}.
CC   -!- PTM: Arg-50 and Arg-203 are dimethylated, probably to asymmetric
CC       dimethylarginine. Arginine methylation reduces RNA binding (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Citrullinated by PADI4. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24463520}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the THOC4 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 RRM (RNA recognition motif) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00176}.

CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Binding is severely inhibited by complete or
CC       partial cytosine-specific DNA methylation of the binding motif.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.

RP   INTERACTION WITH NEDD4L, AND UBIQUITINATION.
RX   PubMed=15496141; DOI=10.1042/BJ20040738;

RN   [14]
RP   INTERACTION WITH PPP5C, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=22781750; DOI=10.1016/j.cellsig.2012.07.003;
RA   Bruce D.L., Macartney T., Yong W., Shou W., Sapkota G.P.;
RT   "Protein phosphatase 5 modulates SMAD3 function in the transforming
RT   growth factor-? pathway.";
RL   Cell. Signal. 24:1999-2006(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Receptor-regulated SMAD (R-SMAD) that is an
CC       intracellular signal transducer and transcriptional modulator
CC       activated by TGF-beta (transforming growth factor) and activin
CC       type 1 receptor kinases. Binds the TRE element in the promoter
CC       region of many genes that are regulated by TGF-beta and, on
CC       formation of the SMAD2/SMAD4 complex, activates transcription. May
CC       act as a tumor suppressor in colorectal carcinoma. Positively
CC       regulates PDPK1 kinase activity by stimulating its dissociation
CC       from the 14-3-3 protein YWHAQ which acts as a negative regulator
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Momomer; the absence of TGF-beta. Interacts with ZNF580.
CC       Heterodimer; in the presence of TGF-beta. Forms a heterodimer with
CC       co-SMAD, SMAD4, in the nucleus to form the transactivation complex
CC       SMAD2/SMAD4. Found in a complex with SMAD3 and TRIM33 upon
CC       addition of TGF-beta. Interacts with ACVR1B, SMAD3 and TRIM33.
CC       Interacts (via the MH2 domain) with ZFYVE9; may form trimers with
CC       the SMAD4 co-SMAD. Interacts with FOXH1, homeobox protein TGIF,
CC       PEBP2-alpha subunit, CREB-binding protein (CBP), EP300, SKI and
CC       SNW1. Interacts with SNON; when phosphorylated at Ser-465/467.
CC       Interacts (via PY-motif) with SMURF2. Interacts with SKOR1 and
CC       SKOR2. Interacts with PRDM16. Interacts (via MH2 domain) with
CC       LEMD3. Interacts with RBPMS. Interacts (dephosphorylated form, via
CC       the MH1 and MH2 domains) with RANBP3 (via its C-terminal R
CC       domain); the interaction results in the export of dephosphorylated
CC       SMAD3 out of the nucleus and termination of the TGF-beta
CC       signaling. Interacts with NEDD4L in response to TGF-beta.
CC       Interacts with WWP1, AIP1 and HGS. Interacts with PML. Interacts
CC       with PDPK1 (via PH domain). Interacts with DAB2; the interactions
CC       are enhanced upon TGF-beta stimulation. Interacts with USP15.
CC       Interacts with PPP5C. Interacts with LDLRAD4 (via the SMAD
CC       interaction motif). Interacts (via MH2 domain) with PMEPA1 (via
CC       the SMAD interaction motif). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10681527,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11094085, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15221015,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15356634, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15496141,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22781750}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P97471:Smad4; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-2337932, EBI-5259270;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Cytoplasmic and nuclear in the absence of TGF-
CC       beta. On TGF-beta stimulation, migrates to the nucleus when
CC       complexed with SMAD4. On dephosphorylation by phosphatase PPM1A,
CC       released from the SMAD2/SMAD4 complex, and exported out of the
CC       nucleus by interaction with RANBP1 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC         Comment=mRNA corresponding to the isoform Long is approximately
CC         20-fold more abundant. Both forms are coexpressed throughout
CC         mouse development.;
CC       Name=Long;
CC         IsoId=Q62432-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=Short; Synonyms=Deltaexon3;
CC         IsoId=Q62432-2; Sequence=VSP_021571;
CC   -!- PTM: In response to TGF-beta, phosphorylated on the C-terminal SXS
CC       motif by TGF-beta and activin type 1 receptor kinases,
CC       phosphorylation declines progressively in a SETD8-dependent
CC       manner. Phosphorylation in this motif is required for interaction
CC       with a number of proteins including SMURF2, SNON and SMAD4 in
CC       response to TGF-beta. Dephosphorylated in this motif by PPM1A
CC       leading to disruption of the SMAD2/3-SMAD4 complex, nuclear export
CC       and termination of the TGF-beta signaling. In response to decorin,
CC       the naturally occurring inhibitor of TGF-beta signaling,
CC       phosphorylated on Ser-240 by CaMK2. Phosphorylated by MAPK3 upon
CC       EGF stimulation; which increases transcriptional activity and
CC       stability, and is blocked by calmodulin. Phosphorylated by PDPK1.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12672795, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15356634}.
CC   -!- PTM: In response to TGF-beta, ubiquitinated by NEDD4L; which
CC       promotes its degradation. Monoubiquitinated, leading to prevent
CC       DNA-binding. Deubiquitination by USP15 alleviates inhibition and
CC       promotes activation of TGF-beta target genes (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Acetylated on Lys-19 by coactivators in response to TGF-beta
CC       signaling, which increases transcriptional activity.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the dwarfin/SMAD family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 MH1 (MAD homology 1) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00438}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 MH2 (MAD homology 2) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00439}.

RP   FUNCTION AS REGULATOR OF CILIUM LENGTH.
RX   PubMed=20096584; DOI=10.1016/j.cub.2009.11.072;
RA   Besschetnova T.Y., Kolpakova-Hart E., Guan Y., Zhou J., Olsen B.R.,
RA   Shah J.V.;

RP   INTERACTION WITH AKAP5; ADCY5; ADCY6 AND PDE4C.
RX   PubMed=21670265; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1016214108;
RA   Choi Y.H., Suzuki A., Hajarnis S., Ma Z., Chapin H.C., Caplan M.J.,
RA   Pontoglio M., Somlo S., Igarashi P.;
RT   "Polycystin-2 and phosphodiesterase 4C are components of a ciliary A-
RT   kinase anchoring protein complex that is disrupted in cystic kidney

RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 108:10679-10684(2011).
RN   [11]
RP   FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, INTERACTION WITH PKD1L1, MUTAGENESIS
RP   OF GLU-442, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=21307093; DOI=10.1242/dev.058149;
RA   Field S., Riley K.L., Grimes D.T., Hilton H., Simon M.,
RA   Powles-Glover N., Siggers P., Bogani D., Greenfield A., Norris D.P.;
RT   "Pkd1l1 establishes left-right asymmetry and physically interacts with
RT   Pkd2.";
RL   Development 138:1131-1142(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Functions as a calcium permeable cation channel involved
CC       in fluid-flow mechanosensation by the primary cilium in renal
CC       epithelium. PKD1 and PKD2 may function through a common signaling
CC       pathway that is necessary for normal tubulogenesis. Acts as a
CC       regulator of cilium length, together with PKD1. The dynamic
CC       control of cilium length is essential in the regulation of
CC       mechanotransductive signaling. The cilium length response creates
CC       a negative feedback loop whereby fluid shear-mediated deflection
CC       of the primary cilium, which decreases intracellular cAMP, leads
CC       to cilium shortening and thus decreases flow-induced signaling.
CC       Also involved in left/right axis specification downstream of nodal
CC       flow: forms a complex with PKD2 in cilia to facilitate flow
CC       detection in left/right patterning. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12514735,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20096584, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21307093}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms homooligomers. Isoform 1 interacts with PKD1 while
CC       isoform 3 does not. PKD1 requires the presence of PKD2 for stable
CC       expression. Interacts with CD2AP. Interacts with HAX1 (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with NEK8. Part of a complex containing
CC       AKAP5, ADCY5, ADCY6 and PDE4C. Isoform 3 does not interact with
CC       PKD1. Interacts with PKD1L1. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18235101, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21307093,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21670265}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       E2JF22:Piezo1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-9823400, EBI-9837938;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell projection, cilium membrane; Multi-pass
CC       membrane protein. Endoplasmic reticulum {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=5;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=O35245-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=delta6;
CC         IsoId=O35245-2; Sequence=VSP_042485, VSP_042486;
CC       Name=3; Synonyms=delta7;
CC         IsoId=O35245-3; Sequence=VSP_042487;
CC       Name=4; Synonyms=delta9;
CC         IsoId=O35245-4; Sequence=VSP_042488, VSP_042489;
CC       Name=5; Synonyms=delta12/13;
CC         IsoId=O35245-5; Sequence=VSP_042490;
CC         Note=Minor isoform.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in mesenchymally derived structures
CC       in the developing embryo at day 12.5. Isoform 1 is predominantly
CC       expressed in kidney at all developmental stages with high levels
CC       also detected in lung. Isoform 3 shows highest expression in brain
CC       with lower expression in kidney and lung, low levels in thymus and
CC       is hardly detectable in liver. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16192288,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21307093, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9716661}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The C-terminal coiled-coil domain binds calcium and
CC       undergoes a calcium-induced conformation change. It is implicated
CC       in oligomerization and the interaction with PKD1 (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the polycystin family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 EF-hand domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00448}.

RX   PubMed=1317856;
RA   Mandon E.C., Ehses I., Rother J., van Echten G., Sandhoff K.;

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Serine palmitoyltransferase (SPT). The heterodimer
CC       formed with LCB1/SPTLC1 constitutes the catalytic core. The
CC       composition of the serine palmitoyltransferase (SPT) complex
CC       determines the substrate preference. The SPTLC1-SPTLC2-SPTSSA
CC       complex shows a strong preference for C16-CoA substrate, while the
CC       SPTLC1-SPTLC2-SPTSSB complex displays a preference for C18-CoA
CC       substrate (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Palmitoyl-CoA + L-serine = CoA + 3-dehydro-D-
CC       sphinganine + CO(2).
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=pyridoxal 5'-phosphate; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:597326;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Lipid metabolism; sphingolipid metabolism.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer with SPTLC1. Component of the serine
CC       palmitoyltransferase (SPT) complex, composed of LCB1/SPTLC1, LCB2
CC       (SPTLC2 or SPTLC3) and ssPT (SPTSSA or SPTSSB) (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:1317856}; Single-pass membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:1317856}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in a variety of tissues.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the class-II pyridoxal-phosphate-dependent
CC       aminotransferase family. {ECO:0000305}.

RT   "The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA

RL   Genome Res. 14:2121-2127(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Regulatory subunit of the cyclin-dependent kinase pair
CC       (CDK9/cyclin-T1) complex, also called positive transcription
CC       elongation factor B (P-TEFb), which is proposed to facilitate the
CC       transition from abortive to productive elongation by
CC       phosphorylating the CTD (carboxy-terminal domain) of the large
CC       subunit of RNA polymerase II (RNA Pol II).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Cyclin-T1 is the predominant cyclin that associates with
CC       CDK9, therby forming a heterodimer called P-TEFb. P-TEFb forms a
CC       complex with AFF4/AF5Q31. Component of a complex which is at least
CC       composed of HTATSF1/Tat-SF1, P-TEFb complex, RNA pol II, SUPT5H,
CC       and NCL/nucleolin. Interacts with MDFIC (By similarity). Does not
CC       bind efficiently to the transactivation domain of HIV-1 Tat.
CC       Component of the 7SK snRNP complex at least composed of P-TEFb
CC       (composed of CDK9 and CCNT1/cyclin-T1), HEXIM1, HEXIM2, BCDIN3,
CC       SART3 proteins and 7SK and U6 snRNAs. Interacts with BRD4,
CC       probably to target chromatin binding (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q91Y44:Brdt; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-2655009, EBI-6260929;
CC       P28574:Max; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-2655009, EBI-1183003;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the cyclin family. Cyclin C subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [4]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.6 ANGSTROMS) OF 376-579.
RG   Joint center for structural genomics (JCSG);
RT   "Crystal structure of a heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein l
RT   (hnrpl) from Mus musculus at 1.60 a resolution.";
RL   Submitted (NOV-2011) to the PDB data bank.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Splicing factor binding to exonic or intronic sites and
CC       acting as either an activator or repressor of exon inclusion.
CC       Exhibits a binding preference for CA-rich elements. Component of
CC       the heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein (hnRNP) complexes and
CC       associated with most nascent transcripts. Associates, together
CC       with APEX1, to the negative calcium responsive element (nCaRE) B2
CC       of the APEX2 promoter.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Identified in a IGF2BP1-dependent mRNP granule complex
CC       containing untranslated mRNAs. Interacts with HNRNPLL. Interacts
CC       with APEX1; the interaction is DNA-dependent. Component of a
CC       complex with SETD2 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nucleoplasm {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Note=Localized in cytoplasmic mRNP
CC       granules containing untranslated mRNAs.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: RRM domain 2 has moderate RNA-binding affinity. RRM
CC       domains 3 and 4 may facilitate RNA looping when binding to two
CC       appropriately separated binding sites within the same target pre-
CC       mRNA (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylation at Ser-541 by CaMK4 enhances interaction with
CC       a CaMK4-responsive RNA element (CaRRE1), and prevents inclusion of
CC       the stress axis-regulated exon (STREX) of the KCNMA1 potassium
CC       channel transcripts upon membrane depolarization. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 4 RRM (RNA recognition motif) domains.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00176}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAH27206.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May be involved in p53-induced cell cycle arrest in G2/M
CC       phase by interfering with microtubule rearrangements that are
CC       required to enter mitosis. Overexpression delays G2/M phase
CC       progression.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton. Note=Associated
CC       with microtubules.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expression begins at S phase, accumulates in
CC       late S/G2 phase and disappears in G1 phase.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10984615}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By p53 when exposed to different DNA damaging agents,
CC       including gamma irradiation and chemotherapeutic drugs.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated in mitosis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10984615}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Functions as a component of the DNA-binding general
CC       transcription factor complex TFIID, a multimeric protein complex
CC       that plays a central role in mediating promoter responses to
CC       various activators and repressors. Present in both of the
CC       previously described TFIID species which either lack or contain
CC       TAFII30 (TFIID alpha and TFIID beta respectively) (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: TFIID is composed of TATA binding protein (TBP) and a
CC       number of TBP-associated factors (TAFs). Interacts with TAFII250,
CC       TAFII100, TAFII28, TAFII20, and TAFII18, but not with TAFII30 or
CC       TBP. Component of some MLL1/MLL complex, at least composed of the
CC       core components KMT2A/MLL1, ASH2L, HCFC1/HCF1, WDR5 and RBBP5, as
CC       well as the facultative components BAP18, CHD8, E2F6, HSP70,
CC       INO80C, KANSL1, LAS1L, MAX, MCRS1, MGA, MYST1/MOF, PELP1, PHF20,
CC       PRP31, RING2, RUVB1/TIP49A, RUVB2/TIP49B, SENP3, TAF1, TAF4, TAF6,
CC       TAF7, TAF9 and TEX10. Binds to CIITA and TAF1, inhibits their
CC       acetyltransferase activity, thereby repressing activated
CC       transcription and behaving as a repressor at these promoters (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The [KR]-[STA]-K motif is specifically recognized by the
CC       SETD7 methyltransferase. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated by CIITA. Phosphorylation at Ser-256 by TAF1
CC       in early G1 phase disrupts binding to TAF1 (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TAF7 family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Binds to WASL/N-WASP and suppresses its translocation
CC       from the nucleus to the cytoplasm, thereby inhibiting its
CC       cytoplasmic function. Plays a role in the regulation of cell
CC       morphology and cytoskeletal organization. Required in the control
CC       of cell shape and migration. May play a role in cytokinesis. May
CC       be involved in pre-mRNA splicing. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14697212}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with the N-terminus of HTT and with the
CC       phosphorylated C-terminal domain of POLR2A (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with AKAP8L, SF1, SRPK1, CARD8, ATBF1 and MECP2.
CC       Interacts through the WW domains with formin proline-rich regions
CC       and with WASL/N-WASP. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14697212,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16391387, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8605874,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9171351}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus speckle. Nucleus matrix.
CC       Note=Colocalizes with AKAP8L in the nuclear matrix.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:

RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=C57BL/6, and OF1; TISSUE=Brain, and Hippocampus;
RA   Lubec G., Yang J.W., Zigmond M., Kang S.U., Sunyer B., Chen W.-Q.;
RL   Submitted (JAN-2009) to UniProtKB.
RN   [4]
RP   IDENTIFICATION IN A COMPLEX WITH HSP90AA1 AND NR3C1.
RX   PubMed=9195923; DOI=10.1074/jbc.272.26.16224;
RA   Silverstein A.M., Galigniana M.D., Chen M.S., Owens-Grillo J.K.,
RA   Chinkers M., Pratt W.B.;
RT   "Protein phosphatase 5 is a major component of glucocorticoid
RT   receptor.hsp90 complexes with properties of an FK506-binding
RT   immunophilin.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 272:16224-16230(1997).
RN   [5]
RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=18771283; DOI=10.1021/bi8011862;
RA   Banerjee A., Periyasamy S., Wolf I.M., Hinds T.D. Jr., Yong W.,
RA   Shou W., Sanchez E.R.;
RT   "Control of glucocorticoid and progesterone receptor subcellular
RT   localization by the ligand-binding domain is mediated by distinct
RT   interactions with tetratricopeptide repeat proteins.";
RL   Biochemistry 47:10471-10480(2008).
RN   [6]
RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-171, AND IDENTIFICATION BY
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: PPIases accelerate the folding of proteins. It catalyzes
CC       the cis-trans isomerization of proline imidic peptide bonds in
CC       oligopeptides. Proposed to act as a co-chaperone in HSP90
CC       complexes such as in unligated steroid receptors heterocomplexes.
CC       Different co-chaperones seem to compete for association with HSP90
CC       thus establishing distinct HSP90-co-chaperone-receptor complexes
CC       with the potential to exert tissue-specific receptor activity
CC       control. May have a preference for estrogen receptor complexes and
CC       is not found in glucocorticoid receptor complexes. May be involved
CC       in cytoplasmic dynein-dependent movement of the receptor from the
CC       cytoplasm to the nucleus. May regulate MYB by inhibiting its DNA-
CC       binding activity. Involved in regulation of AHR signaling by
CC       promoting the formation of the AHR:ARNT dimer; the function is
CC       independent of HSP90 but requires the chaperone activity region.
CC       Involved in regulation of UV radiation-induced apoptosis.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18771283}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Peptidylproline (omega=180) = peptidylproline
CC       (omega=0).
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Less sensitive to inhibition by cyclosporin A
CC       than is CYP-18.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Identified in ESR1 or NR3C1/GCR steroid receptor-
CC       chaperone complexes. Found in HSP90 chaperone complexes with
CC       kinase clients LCK or EIF2AK1. Two monomers associate with one
CC       HSP90 homodimer. Interacts with HSP90AA1. Interacts with HSP90AB1;
CC       PPID and FKBP4 compete for binding to HSP90AB1 and the interaction
CC       is mutually exclusive with the PPID:HSPA8 interaction. Interacts
CC       with HSPA8; PPID and STIP1 but not FKBP4 compete for binding to
CC       HSPA8 and the interaction is mutually exclusive with the
CC       PPID:HSP90AB1 interaction. Interacts with S100A1 and S100A2; the
CC       interactions dissociate the PPID:HSP90AA1 interaction. Interacts
CC       with S100A6. Interacts with MYB, ILF2, XRCC6, GNB2L1 and RPS3.
CC       Interacts with cytoplasmic dynein 1 intermediate chain (DYNC1I1 or
CC       DYNC1I2). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9195923}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus, nucleolus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus, nucleoplasm {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the cyclophilin-type PPIase family. PPIase
CC       D subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PPIase cyclophilin-type domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00156}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 3 TPR repeats. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00339}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: This protein should not be confused with mitochondrial
CC       peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase F (PPIF) which is often
CC       referred to as cyclophilin D or CypD. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May be involved in RNA processing or transport. Has RNA
CC       and Mg(2+)-dependent ATPase activity (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + H(2)O = ADP + phosphate.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Mitochondrion
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Transported between these two compartments.
CC       Nuclear localization depends on active RNA polymerase II
CC       transcription (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the DEAD box helicase family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 helicase ATP-binding domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00541}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 helicase C-terminal domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00542}.
